Constructor Detail

KVServer

public KVServer()
Start KV Server at given port

Parameters:
port - given port for storage server to operate
cacheSize - specifies how many key-value pairs the server is allowed to keep in-memory
strategy - specifies the cache replacement strategy in case the cache is full and there is a GET- or PUT-request on a key that is currently not contained in the cache. Options are "FIFO", "LRU", and "LFU".
Method Detail

run

public void run()
Initializes and starts the server. Loops until the the server should be closed.

stopServer

public void stopServer()
Stops the server insofar that it won't listen at the given port any more.

private void communicateECS()

private void initializeServer()

initKVServer

public void initKVServer(Metadata metadata,
                         int cacheSize,
                         java.lang.String displacementStrategy)
Initialize the KVServer with the metaÂ­data, itâ€™s local cache size, and the cache displacement strategy, and block it for client requests, i.e., all client requests are rejected with an SERVER_STOPPED error message; ECS requests have to be processed.

start

public void start()
Starts the KVServer, all client requests and all ECS requests are processed.

stop

public void stop()
Stops the KVServer, all client requests are rejected and only ECS requests are processed.

shutDown

public void shutDown()
Exits the KVServer application.

lockWrite

public void lockWrite()
Lock the KVServer for write operations.

unLockWrite

public void unLockWrite()
Unlock the KVServer for write operations.

update

Update the meta­data repository of this server

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Main entry point for the echo server application.

Parameters:
args - contains the port number at args[0].
